channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for WA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for WA

item.title: Report E-2024030057
item.description:
Report E-2024030057

  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDEX FREIGHT, INC.

item.title: Report X-2024021791
item.description:
Report X-2024021791

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-07T15:11:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-23
  • City: BURLINGTON
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Box was found wet as it left trailer. Then brought to repack to be inspected and repacked. When inspected at repack item was found to be leaking from cap. When SDS was looked up item was discovered to be regulated. Outer box was unmarked. DescribePack: Cap on crooked. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Was put in a plastic tote with plastic bag to prevent leaking on other boxes.

item.title: Report X-2024021611
item.description:
Report X-2024021611

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-06T18:13:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-15
  • City: TUKWILA
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: LEAKING STEEL DRUM WAS DISCOVERED BY AN AUDITOR WHO THEN NOTIFIED A RESPONDER. ALL PPE (GLOVES, GOGGLES, BOOTS, APRON, SILVER LINING) WAS PUT ON AND DRUM WAS PLACED INTO A YELLOW TUB/DMP BAG. DRUM WAS THEN TRANSFERRED TO THE DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. ALL PPE/TUBS WERE THEN DECONTAMINATED AND DRUM WAS FURTHER PROCESSED INTO ETT.

item.title: Report X-2024021562
item.description:
Report X-2024021562

  • State: WA

  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER RESPONDED TO IRREG 2 REVENUE RECOVERY. RESPONDER USED DECISION TREE FOR PROPER IN INSTRUCTIONS FOR RESPONSE. RESPONDER FOLLOWED INSTRUCTIONS AND GREEN BAGGED WITH ZEP AND ACTIVATED CARBON AS PER INSTRUCTIONS.

item.title: Report E-2024020539
item.description:
Report E-2024020539

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-01T18:14:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-26
  • City: PASCO
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO notified ERTS regarding one punctured bag containing hazardous product, GreenCleanÂ® PRO. The bag was punctured by a forklift. This resulted in the release of approximately 1lb of product onto the concrete dock floor. A Contractor cleaned-up the spill and containerized the damaged bag for waste disposal. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were impacted by the release.

item.title: Report X-2024021331
item.description:
Report X-2024021331

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-01T18:14:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-12
  • City: DUPONT
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: DURING UNLOAD, PACKAGE HANDLER FOUND A WET HAZMAT PACKAGE. IMMEDIATELY THEY PLACE IT IN THE PLASTIC LINED TUB . DescribePack: WE FOUND THERE WAS A DENTED PUNCTURED HOLE AT THE BOTTOM OF THE PLASTIC CONTAINER DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PLACED THE LEAKING PKG INSIDE A PLASTIC LINED TUB
